ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An is a type of
that is an information message such as a note, warning, or error message. The may be attached to an element, a group of elements, a node, or an entire model.
specifies the severity of the .
specifies the text of the .
An is the text and graphical information documenting the finite element and associated detail analyses. An may be one or both of a or a .
specifies the being documented. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the being documented
specifies the being documented. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A is a type of representing information that has been calculated by an analysis step.

A is a specified value of a degree of freedom at a node or a relationship between freedoms at many nodes for an . A Constraint shall be one of the following:
;
; or a
.
specifies the identifier for the constraint.
specifies the set of objects in which the constraint is applied.

An Element_nodal_freedom_actions is a type of
hat represents the values of nodal action for an element. The action is applied by the element to the node.
An describes the operations carried out upon the finite element model as a series of analysis steps. A finite element model may have one or more sets of control information aggregated by the .

specifies the approval of the analysis operations. The approval indicates acceptance and establishes the as a particular version of the approval date. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
identifies the name of the analysis code to carry out the analysis.
specifies the on which the operations specified by the is carried out upon.

An is a is a single step in an . An shall be one of the following:
,
.
specifies the to which the step applies.
specifies the identifier for the step in the analysis.

ext_description.p: specifies the initial state of the node and element variables for the step.
ext_description.example: Node variables include information such as loads and moments. Element variables include information such as initial strains and pressures.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: identifies the sequence number for the step in the analysis
An is administrative information for a finite element analysis.

specifies the approval of the analysis output. The approval indicates that these are acceptable results from an analysis view and establishes the as a particular version of the approval date. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

An is the state of the node and element analysis variables at the end of a step. An shall be one of the following:
,
.
specifies the that specified the initial conditions and analysis process for the step.
the administrative information for the finite element analysis.

An represents the values of information defining the node and element variables within a finite element model at an instant in time. An shall be a
,
,
,
.

ext_description.p: specifies the aggregation of the variables and their values for the nodes and elements in the finite element model.
ext_description.example: Node variables include such information as loads, moments, displacements, rotations, and reaction forces. Element variables include such information as pressures, stresses, and strains.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An is the variables and their values for the nodes and elements in the finite element model. An is both information known before and after an analysis, such as external loadings, and prescribed values of variables at a boundary, and therefore either requests or represents information calculated by the analysis, such as, element stresses, and values of variables at unconstrained nodes. In this manner, state definition output from one step may be used as input for a subsequent state definition. An shall be an:
,
,
,
,
, or a
.
specifies the , , , or whose analysis variables, or analysis variables and their values are being specified.
specifies the name of the file containing the graphical information.

A is a type of
that is a linear multi-point constraint equation that specifies the nodal freedoms and their coefficients. The value of the constraint equation coefficient is set by a application object.
specifies the set of nodes, groups, or detailed geometric model elements associated with the freedoms and their coefficients for each term of the .

A is a type of
that defines the constraint equation coefficient associated with the freedoms and their coefficients.
specifies the to which the coefficient is applied.

A is a type of
that is obtained by a combination of previously calculated and specified states.

A is a type of
that represents a single step in a modes and frequencies analysis.
specifies the final equilibrium state for a .
specifies the values of the lower and upper frequency bounds.
specifies the number of modes to be calculated in the analysis.

A is a type of
that defines the state of node and element variables at the end of a modes and frequencies analysis step.
the set of objects that result from the modes and frequencies analysis. There is one state per mode and frequency pair.

A is a type of
that constrains the degrees of freedom for a node, for a group, or for the nodes associated with a , in an .
specifies where the Nodal_degree_of_freedom_reduction is applied. The node shall be a , a Group, or a Node.

A is a type of
that specifies information at a node of the model with respect to the solution degrees of freedom. The information may be values for the solution degrees of freedom such as x- translation, or z-rotation, or loads applied in the direction of the solution degrees of freedom such as values for x-force, or z-moment. These may be loads applied to a node by elements of the model, or loads applied to a node from outside the model.

An is a type of
equesting information in the form of computer readable objects.
specifies the set of objects to which the output requests apply.
A is a type of that constrains for one or more degrees of freedom at a single node. The values of the constraint are set by the object.
specifies where the is applied. The node shall be a , a Group, or a Node

A is a type of
that defines the value of a .
specifies the to which the coefficient is applied.

A is a type of
representing information that is specified. None of the information in it is a result of a previous calculation

A is a type of
that defines a single step in a static .
pecifies the final equilibrium state for the p.

A is a type of
that defines the state of node and element variables at the end of a static analysis step.

ext_description.p: specifies the final state of the node and element variables for the step.
ext_description.example: Node variables include such information as displacements, rotations, and reaction forces. Element variables include such information as stresses and strains.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the name of the file containing the tabular information.
